author: Al Weaver
description: Senate Republicans on Monday indicated they have multiple concerns with President Trump potentially being gifted a new luxury jet from Qatar, ranging from safety to legal and ethical worries. Trump on Monday defended his potential acceptance of a new Boeing 747-8 airplane from the government of Qatar to serve as a replacement for the current…
title: Senate GOP weighs safety, legal concerns over Trump Qatar jet gift

author: Tara Suter
description: Former Treasury Department Secretary Larry Summers said Monday that there was no question that President Trump blinked when it came to the recent agreement on a 90-day pause between the United States and China on most tariffs imposed on each other since early last month. “I think it’s very clear that it’s President Trump who…
title: Larry Summers: No question Trump blinked on China tariffs

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: House Republicans on the Energy and Commerce Committee this week unveiled a plan to cut more than $880 billion to pay for a significant portion of President Trump’s domestic agenda.  After months of wrangling over how deeply to cut Medicaid, committee Chair Brett Guthrie (R-Ky.) appears to have avoided the most politically controversial proposals while…
title: What to know about the GOP’s Medicaid bill

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump is heading to the Middle East this week for the first extended foreign trip of his second term, with stops planned in Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates (UAE) and Qatar. Trump and his aides are expected to focus intensely on financial investments and trade during the trip, but it will also be…
title: Trump’s Middle East trip: 5 things to watch

author: Mychael Schnell
description: House Republicans are charging ahead with deep Medicaid cuts and an extension of the 2017 tax cuts, two policies at the heart of President Trump’s domestic agenda that are showcasing fierce divisions within the GOP conference. Both policy issues pit GOP moderates against conservatives, and threaten to delay action on the massive budget reconciliation package…
title: GOP charges ahead despite deep divisions on Medicaid, SALT

author: Tobias Burns
description: U.S. and Chinese trade negotiators agreed over the weekend to lower mutually imposed triple-digit tariffs in a significant de-escalation of the ongoing trade war between Washington, D.C., and Beijing. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said Sunday after talks in Switzerland that “substantial progress” had been made between the two countries. China and the U.S. agreed to…
title: 5 takeaways from US-China trade truce

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump defended his decision to accept a luxury Boeing jet from Qatar, calling it “stupid” for him to turn it down amid an influx of criticism from both sides of the aisle over the gift. “I could be a stupid person and say, ‘Oh no, we don’t want a free plane.’ We give free…
title: Trump goes on defense over Qatar jet gift

author: Tara Suter
description: The Episcopal Church has halted a refugee resettlement program with the federal government over the prioritization of white South Africans while other populations see their immigration protections removed. “Just over two weeks ago, the federal government informed Episcopal Migration Ministries that under the terms of our federal grant, we are expected to resettle white Afrikaners…
title: Episcopal Church halts refugee partnership with feds over white South Africans

author: Jared Gans
description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz (D) will speak at the Democratic state conventions in South Carolina and California at the end of this month as the former vice presidential candidate stirs speculation of his own presidential ambitions.  The two states are particularly notable as South Carolina is the first state in the Democratic primary process and…
title: Walz speaking at Democratic conventions in South Carolina, California

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Rep. Randy Feenstra (R-Iowa) has filed paperwork to run for Iowa governor in 2026, joining a crowded field of Republicans seeking to replace Gov. Kim Reynolds (R) and facing off against Democrat Auditors Rob Sand.
title: Rep. Randy Feenstra files to run for Iowa governor

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries (D-N.Y.) derided President Trump as a “wannabe” king after the president confirmed plans to accept a luxury jet from the Qatari government. “Wannabe Kings accept corrupt gifts from foreign powers. Not the President,” Jeffries wrote in a post on X, responding to reporting from ABC News that Trump was planning to…
title: Jeffries targets Trump over Qatari jet gift, citing ‘Wannabe Kings’

author: Jared Gans
description: Former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo (D), who is the frontrunner for the Democratic nomination in the New York City mayoral race, lost out on more than $600,000 in public matching funds over accusations that his campaign illegally coordinated with a super PAC.  The ruling from the New York City Campaign Finance Board came after…
title: Cuomo denied $600K in campaign funds over allegedly coordinating with super PAC

author: Julia Shapero
description: American Bitcoin, Eric Trump’s bitcoin mining company, announced Monday that it plans to go public.  The firm will merge with fellow bitcoin mining firm Gryphon Digital Mining and operate under the American Bitcoin brand, appearing on the Nasdaq under the ticker “ABTC,” according to a press release.  “Our vision for American Bitcoin is to create…
title: Eric Trump’s bitcoin mining venture to go public

author: Rachel Frazin
description: The Energy Department has announced proposals to cut dozens of energy efficiency and other rules in what it is describing as the ”‘largest deregulatory effort in history.” The department plans to ax a long list of efficiency regulations, including those pertaining to stoves, ovens, showerheads, clothes washers, dishwashers and microwaves. The rules also apply to…
title: Energy Department proposes to cut 47 rules in ‘largest deregulatory effort in history’

author: Tara Suter
description: Mahmoud Khalil, the former Columbia University student who has been detained by Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), wrote to his infant son in an opinion piece for The Guardian published Sunday, saying his “absence is not unique.” “My heart aches that I could not hold you in my arms and hear your first cry, that…
title: Mahmoud Khalil writes to infant son: ‘My absence is not unique’

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: House Republicans are looking to raise excise taxes on private university endowments in President Trump’s tax bill as the administration battles with higher education.  The text of the legislative package released Tuesday shows Republicans want to increase university endowment taxes ranging from a 1.4 percent to a 21 percent increase.   For institutions like Harvard…
title: House Republicans propose higher taxes on university endowments

author: Alex Gangitano
description: The first group of white South Africans arrived in the United States on Monday, the State Department announced following the prioritization of the Afrikaner refugee resettlement program. State spokesperson Tammy Bruce argued in a statement that the group is vulnerable and facing unjust racial discrimination in South Africa, saying taking them in is an action…
title: First group of white South Africans arrives in US as refugees

author: Rachel Frazin
description: House Republicans on Monday announced that they plan to repeal Democrats’ tax credits for electric vehicles (EVs) and phase out those that apply to climate-friendly energy sources. The green energy credits have long been in the GOP’s crosshairs as party leaders decry climate spending. But they have also emerged as a point of conflict within…
title: Republicans axing EV credit, phasing out ones for green energy in budget bill

author: Aris Folley
description: House Republicans are moving forward with plans to raise the nation’s debt ceiling by $4 trillion as part of a larger plan to advance President Trump’s tax agenda.  The proposal, which was included in legislative text unveiled by the House Ways and Means Committee on Monday, is in line with House instructions outlined in a…
title: House GOP unveils plan to raise debt limit by $4 trillion

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: Sen. Ruben Gallego (D-Ariz.) released a new immigration plan Monday, wading into a contentious debate as President Trump pushes to crack down at the border. The plan from Gallego follows a similar pattern of other past proposals, promoting a pathway to citizenship for Dreamers and others in the U.S. while pushing for expanded personnel and…
title: Gallego unveils immigration plan

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: President Trump confirmed reports Sunday that his administration is planning to accept a luxury jet, a Boeing 747-8, from the Qatari government. Trump insisted the gift would be received by the Defense Department “in a very public and transparent transaction,” as he pushed back on criticism from Democrats who described the arrangement as a grift.…
title: What we know about the luxury jet Qatar plans to give to Trump

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: At least 10 people were hospitalized in Nevada and California after eating Fresh & Ready Foods products, which have been recalled due to a suspected listeria outbreak.
title: Listeria outbreak linked to prepared foods sickens at least 10

author: Tara Suter
description: The last living American Hamas hostage in Gaza has been transferred to Israel, according to the Israel Defense Forces (IDF). In a video posted on the social media platform X on Monday, IDF spokesperson Lt. Col. Nadav Shoshani said that Edan Alexander had “just now crossed into Israeli territory.” “Edan, a soldier in the Golani…
title: Last living American Hamas hostage Edan Alexander transferred to Israel

author: Mychael Schnell
description: The House Ways and Means Committee on Monday released a fuller version of its part of Republicans’ bill full of President Trump’s legislative priorities, kicking off what is expected to be a showdown over the tax provisions in the sprawling measure. The 389-page measure, which is the centerpiece of the GOP’s megabill, is expected to…
title: House panel releases sweeping GOP tax bill

author: Julia Shapero
description: President Trump signed two congressional rollbacks of Biden-era rules from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) that sought to cap overdraft fees and ramp up oversight of digital wallets.   The two rules were finalized in the last few months of the Biden administration, leaving them vulnerable to the lookback provision of the Congressional Review…
title: Trump signs rollbacks of Biden-era overdraft, digital wallet rules

author: Alex Marion, opinion contributor
description: The federal government’s open hostility to our constituents, our needs and our solutions has made serving in local government that much harder.
title: Local governments like mine are fighting back against Trump

author: Reps. Gabe Evans (R-Colo.) and Mike Ezell (R-Miss.), opinion contributors
description: Congressional representatives Gabe Evans and Mike Ezell, who both have experience as police officers, are using their knowledge to introduce and support legislation that empowers local law enforcement to combat crime and protect the American people.
title: Congress can support law enforcement this National Police Week

author: Sharon Udasin
description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom (D) on Monday called on city governments in his state to urgently address the prevalence of homeless encampments, issuing a model ordinance to facilitate local bans. “There’s nothing compassionate about letting people die on the streets,” Newsom said in a statement. “The time for inaction is over. There are no more excuses.”…
title: Newsom urges California cities to clear homeless encampments

author: Al Weaver
description: Senate Democrats are trying to force a vote in response to reports that President Trump will accept a luxury jet from Qatar that will be retrofitted as the next Air Force One.  Sens. Brian Schatz (D-Hawaii), Chris Murphy (D-Conn.), Cory Booker (D-N.J.) and Chris Coons (D-Del.) are pushing a measure that would target the gift,…
title: Senate Democrats seek vote targeting Trump’s acceptance of Qatari plane

author: Mychael Schnell
description: The House Ways and Means Committee is eyeing a plan to increase the state and local tax (SALT) deduction cap by $30,000 for single and joint filers who make $400,000 or less a year, even after key lawmakers vocally rejected that proposal last week. The idea, which four sources confirmed to The Hill, was discussed…
title: House tax writers eye SALT deduction cap rejected by key lawmakers last week

author: Henri LaSane, opinion contributor
description: HBCUs like Florida A&M University have consistently produced exceptional outcomes for their students, and their success is worth studying and replicating by other colleges and universities to address the challenges of student success.
title: Don’t just ask how to help HBCUs. Ask how to learn from them.

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: AAA expects a record number of domestic travelers for Memorial Day, with 45.1 million people expected to travel 50 miles or more between May 22 and May 26, with 87% of them planning to travel by car.
title: Memorial Day travel expected to break 20-year record

author: Jared Gans
description: Texas Sen. John Cornyn (R) is significantly trailing state Attorney General Ken Paxton in an internal GOP primary poll conducted by a super PAC supporting the incumbent, pointing to a potentially challenging reelection bid. The longtime senior senator is behind Paxton in the poll by 16 points, 56 percent to 40 percent, Punchbowl News reported…
title: Cornyn losing to primary rival in poll from top GOP super PAC

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: The Energy and Commerce Committee, which has jurisdiction over Medicaid, surpassed its target of finding $880 billion in savings to help pay for legislation to extend President Trump’s tax cuts and other priorities, according to the Congressional Budget Office (CBO).  In a brief letter to Energy and Commerce Committee Chair Brett Guthrie (R-Ky.), the CBO…
title: CBO: House GOP plan exceeds $880B savings target

author: Julia Shapero
description: A Republican tax bill released late Sunday seeks to block states from regulating artificial intelligence (AI) models for the next 10 years.  The bill text from the House Energy and Commerce Committee would bar states from enforcing laws or regulations governing AI models, AI systems or automated decision systems.  It provides some exemptions for laws…
title: House GOP proposes 10-year ban on state AI regulations

author: Joann Cartiglia, opinion contributor
description: Small business owners like Joann Cartiglia are facing the possibility of bankruptcy due to tariffs on toy imports, and are urging the Trump administration to find an alternative way forward that defends American interests without sacrificing entrepreneurs who embody the American Dream.
title: Tariffs will mean the end for my small business

author: The Hill staff
description: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy is scheduled to provide an update on Newark Liberty International Airport Monday afternoon. The Federal Aviation Administration briefly slowed air traffic at the airport Sunday because a new telecommunications issue affected the Philadelphia facility that guides planes into and out of New Jersey’s largest airport. The disruptions come as the Newark…
title: Watch live: Duffy provides update on Newark airport

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: French President Emmanuel Macron denounced claims Sunday of European leaders taking drugs together on a train to Ukraine based on a photograph of a tissue. “When European unity becomes inconvenient, disinformation goes so far as to make a simple tissue look like drugs,” Macron’s office said in a statement, accusing France’s enemies of trying to…
title: Macron blasts claims of cocaine on train as ‘disinformation’

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Rep. Dan Goldman has dismissed the Trump administration's three-month trade truce with China as a "charade" and a futile attempt to boost American manufacturing.
title: House Democrat: Trump trade truce with China ‘just a charade’

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: The Trump administration on Monday formally lifted a shield on deportation of Afghans in the U.S, arguing improving conditions in the Taliban-run country mean its citizens here no longer merit such protections. The announcement from the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) would end Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for Afghans, a protection ignited by the Biden…
title: Trump administration ends protections from deportation for Afghans

author: Michael Mazza and Shay Khatiri, opinion contributors
description: The prescribed downgrading of American commitments in Europe and the Middle East is a recipe for global instability.
title: Hegseth’s pivot to China leaves the rest of the world to fend for itself

author: Alejandra O'Connell-Domenech
description: President Donald Trump signed an executive order on Monday aimed at slashing prescription drug prices in the U.S. that could lead to the capping of prices at a level equivalent to the cost in similar nations. The U.S. has paid more than other similarly wealthy countries for prescription drugs for decades, with a 2024 study conducted…
title: Trump signs executive order aimed at slashing prescription drug costs

author: Rachel Frazin
description: The House Energy and Commerce Committee’s text for Republicans’ “big, beautiful bill” to advance President Trump’s agenda and fund the government slashes a number of green programs and regulations — and seeks to bolster fossil fuels. The legislation targets a number of programs passed by Democrats in their 2022 climate, tax and health care bill,…
title: House Republicans cut green programs, boost fossil fuels in budget bill

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Senate Democratic Leader Chuck Schumer (N.Y.) says China “got the better” of the Trump administration after Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and U.S. Trade Representative Jamieson Greer announced they reached a deal with Chinese officials to de-escalate the trade war between the world’s two biggest economies. “Sadly, it looks like China once again got the better…
title: Schumer: China ‘got the better of Trump’

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: CNBC pundit Jim Cramer praised President Trump after the U.S. and China announced an agreement Monday to pause an ongoing trade battle between two of the world’s largest superpowers. “This to me, is a signal that there is maybe a different kind of President Trump happening,” Cramer said on CNBC Monday morning. “President Trump seems…
title: Jim Cramer: Trump looking for ‘less-confrontational style’ with China trade truce

author: Liz Krueger and Jeffrey Dinowitz, opinion contributors
description: New York's Climate Change Superfund Act holds the largest, most profitable global fossil fuel companies accountable for the damage their products have caused, while President Trump's executive order seeks to undermine the state sovereignty and the idea of states holding powerful interests accountable.
title: Trump is illegally trying to overturn state climate laws

author: Dan Perry, Opinion Contributor
description: President Trump's upcoming Middle East trip could mark a geopolitical turning point in the region.
title: Trump’s Middle East trip could end the Gaza War — if he is willing to bash heads

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump on Monday called it “stupid” for him to turn down the gift of a luxury Boeing jet from Qatar, praising the offer from the Arab nation as a “great gesture.” Boeing has had a contract with the U.S. government to deliver a new Air Force One jet, but it’s been faced with a…
title: Trump: I’d be a ‘stupid person’ saying no to Qatari plane

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: The governor of the Mexican state of Baja California said she and her husband were informed that their U.S. tourist visas have been withdrawn. In a post on the social platform X, Marina del Pilar Ávila said she was informed her visa was revoked via consular message, shortly after her husband, Carlos Torres, received a…
title: Baja California governor says US tourist visa withdrawn

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. took a swim in Washington, D.C.'s Rock Creek despite warnings about high bacterial levels, drawing attention to his unconventional views on health policy.
title: RFK Jr. goes swimming in DC’s Rock Creek despite NPS guidance on bacteria

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump on Monday raised the possibility of flying to Turkey later this week to join talks between Russia and Ukraine if there was a chance of progress in efforts to stop the fighting between the countries. Russian President Vladimir Putin and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky have indicated they could meet for direct talks in…
title: Trump floats flying to Turkey to join potential Russia-Ukraine talks

author: Harlan Ullman, Opinion Contributor
description: The Russian conventional military threat to NATO and Western Europe is minimal.
title: Is the UK overreacting to Trump and Putin?

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) briefly slowed air traffic at Newark Liberty International Airport on Sunday because a new telecommunications issue affected the Philadelphia facility that guides planes into and out of New Jersey’s largest airport. The FAA said in a statement that the agency slowed traffic amid work to ensure “redundancies were working as…
title: Newark Airport traffic slowed due to new telecommunications issue

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Conservative provocateur Laura Loomer criticized President Trump for accepting a $400 million Boeing jet from Qatar, citing the country's ties to the Muslim Brotherhood and Hamas, while Trump defended the arrangement as a gift.
title: Loomer: Qatari jet gift a ‘stain’ on Trump presidency

author: Sylvan Lane
description: Stocks soared Monday morning after the Trump administration and China announced they would temporarily slash steep tariffs on each other’s goods. The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose more than 1,000 points after the opening bell Monday, a 2.6 percent increase. The S&P 500 index was up 3 percent and the Nasdaq composite was up 4.1…
title: Stocks soar after US, China strike trade truce

author: Juan Williams, Opinion Contributor
description: Both the new and former pope have support among most Americans for their pro-immigrant stance.
title: Pope Leo, like Pope Francis before him, cares deeply about immigrants

author: Steven Lubet, Opinion Contributor
description: The U.S. Supreme Court will consider the validity of President Trump's executive order to exclude children of "unlawful" entrants from birthright citizenship, with many justices likely to express extreme skepticism about the order's constitutionality.
title: Supreme failure: Trump’s lawyers will flop in arguments against birthright citizenship

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Rep. Ritchie Torres (D-N.Y.) on Sunday called for an ethics review of the Trump administration’s plans to accept a luxury jet from the Qatari government for temporary use as the official Air Force One, before it’s transferred to President Trump’s presidential library for personal use. In a letter to the Government Accountability Office (GAO) comptroller…
title: House Democrat demands ethics review of Qatari jet gift to Trump

author: Aris Folley
description: The Trump administration is facing pressure to restore a public website that showed how funding is apportioned to federal agencies and that lawmakers on both sides say is required by law. Advocates and Democrats have spent weeks ratcheting up criticism over a move by the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) to take down the online database.…
title: Trump faces bipartisan pressure to restore public funding tracker

author: Julia Manchester
description: Former Social Security Administrator Martin O’Malley’s Win Back Our Country PAC called on Democrats to “not let up” on protecting the entitlement program upfront on Monday amid concerns over potential cuts to the program.  In a memo exclusively obtained by The Hill, O’Malley accuses the Trump administration of leading a campaign to “break” the Social…
title: Former SSA Administrator Martin O’Malley urges Democrats to ‘not let up’ on Social Security

author: Jared Gans
description: Rep. Mike Lawler (R-N.Y.) is facing a difficult decision as he weighs whether to run for New York governor, potentially putting him at odds with a close ally of President Trump, or run for reelection in a competitive House district. Lawler seemed just a few weeks ago to be the favorite for the GOP nomination…
title: Lawler faces crossroads as he weighs New York governor bid

author: Mike Lillis
description: Progressive Democrats are on a tear.  The party liberals — particularly younger voices, in Congress and outside of it — are increasingly disillusioned with how the Democrats’ old guard is managing the high-stakes battle against President Trump, who is using his second term to dismantle the conventions of law and government. On issues as varied…
title: Liberals rail at establishment: ‘Too many corporate, establishment politicians’

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Democratic senators are having private conversations about how to help Sen. John Fetterman (D-Pa.) in the wake of an explosive report that the first-term Pennsylvania senator is behaving erratically and in a way that may pose a danger to himself or others, according to sources familiar with those discussions. Two Democratic senators told The Hill…
title: Senate Democrats worried about Fetterman discussing ways to help

author: Sylvan Lane
description: President Trump attacked Democratic lawmakers for criticizing his upcoming receipt of a luxury Boeing jet from Qatar. In a Sunday night post on Truth Social, the president dismissed critics of a reported plan for Trump to receive a Boeing 747-8 airplane from the government of Qatar. The plane would replace Air Force One, according to…
title: Trump blasts Democratic criticism of Qatar plane gift: ‘World Class Losers!!!’

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Rep. Jamie Raskin (D-Md.) called reports that President Trump was planning to accept a luxury jet from Qatar “a grift” and said the president must seek Congressional approval first. “Trump must seek Congress’ consent to take this $300 million gift from Qatar,” Raskin wrote on X on Sunday. He was responding to reporting from ABC…
title: Raskin blasts Trump for Qatar plane ‘grift’
